Exaggerate: The claim states that the U.N. arms treaty will mandate a "new international gun registry," which may be an exaggeration of the actual provisions of the treaty.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that the U.N. arms treaty will mandate a "new international gun registry."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the existence of a "gun registry" would automatically lead to global gun confiscation, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider or acknowledge any alternative explanations or interpretations of the provisions of the U.N. arms treaty.
